questions.question: During Visual Manoeuvring (Circling) what is the maximum airspeed for a Cat B aircraft?
When the VM(C) area has been established the obstacle clearance altitude/height (OCA/H) is determined for:
options: a. all categories of aircraft, and it is the same for all of them.
b. each category of aircraft and it may be different for each of them.
c. only for categories A and B aircraft.
d. only for categories C. D and E aircraft.

questions.question:
It is permissible to eliminate from consideration a particular sector where a prominent obstacle exists in the visual manoeuvring (circling) area outside the final approach and missed approach areas.
When this option is exercised, the published procedure:
options: a. prohibits a circling approach to the affected runway.
b. prohibits circling within the sector in which the obstacle exists.
c. permits circling only in VMC.
d. recommends that circling is not carried out in the affected sector.

questions.question: A circling approach is:
options: a. a flight manoeuvre performed only under radar vectoring.
b. a flight manoeuvre where visual contact with the underlying terrain is maintained.
c. a visual manoeuvre keeping the runway in sight.
d. a visual manoeuvre only conducted in IMC.
